instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3115: What is 820-3115? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PM_SLP_S3_L: What is PM_SLP_S3_L? PM_SLP_S3_L puts the machine to sleep in an S3 state when it is asserted, the _L means it is asserted when it is low voltage. When this signal is 3.3v the machine will be asked to turn on S0 power rails and begin the bootup process.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> : 1 sec fan spin loop with corrosion on LVDS side of mb in multiple places
threads.message:
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> stuck in 1 second fan spin loop.  Multiple places with corrosion, cleaned well with ultrasonic. 

Replaced <CHIP>U5400</CHIP> and ran wires reconnecting it to <RESISTOR>R5400</RESISTOR>.
Another bad trace between <TRANSISTOR>Q5490</TRANSISTOR> and <RESISTOR>R5494</RESISTOR> fixed

<SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S3_L</SIGNAL> is toggling on and off and I traced it to multiple places on the board looking for it's souce.  It's produced by <CHIP>U1800</CHIP> per the schematic but then I see that is has something to do with GPIO29 which is related to <SIGNAL>SLP_LAN</SIGNAL>.  Is the LAN somehow putting this machine into sleep mode.

much appreciated,
Paul

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> : 1 sec fan spin loop with corrosion on LVDS side of mb in multiple places
threads.message:
Voltage on <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>??
Corrosion around SMC??
Corrosion around bios chip??
Is CPU Vcore coming high???
